byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky reported from Brussels, and Russell Goldman from New York. Katie Rogers contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and RUSSELL GOLDMAN

abstract: Belgian investigators' determination to make no errors in identifying victims of Brussels terrorist attacks has led to slow, agonizing wait for many family members; list of confirmed dead given.

headline.print_headline: No Room for Error Means Slow Confirmation of Families’ Worst Fears
headline.main: After Brussels Attacks, a Slow Process to Confirm Families’ Worst Fears

snippet: Relatives around the world were still waiting for word about missing loved ones, prolonging the agony of those already suffering.
lead_paragraph: Relatives around the world were still waiting for word about missing loved ones, prolonging the agony of those already suffering.
